skills.name: Know times tables up to 12 x 12

explanations.A: I think you added 7 and 6. There are 6 boxes, with 7 chocolates in each, so we need to do 6 x 7.
explanations.B: I think you subtracted 6 from 7. There are 6 boxes, with 7 chocolates in each, so we need to do 6 x 7.
explanations.C: There are 6 boxes of 7, so we do 6 x 7 = 42
explanations.D: Close! This is the answer to 6 x 6, but we want 6 x 7. Try adding on another 6...

explanations.A: I think you subtracted 7 from 12. There are 7 boxes, with 12 chocolates in each, so we need to do 7 x 12.
explanations.B: Close! This is the answer to 7 x 11, but we want 7 x 12. Try adding on another 12!
explanations.C: I think you added 12 and 7. There are 7 boxes, with 12 chocolates in each, so we need to do 7 x 12.
explanations.D: There are 7 boxes of 12, so we do 7 x 12 = 84

explanations.A: I think you added 9 and 7. Julie runs 9 miles 7 times, so we need to do 9 x 7.
explanations.B: Julie runs 9 miles 7 times, so we do 9 x 7 = 63.
explanations.C: I think you subtracted 7 from 9. Julie runs 9 miles 7 times, so we need to do 9 x 7.
explanations.D: Close! This is the answer to 9 x 8, but we want 9 x 7. Think about the answer to 10 x 7, can 9 x 7 be more than that?

explanations.A: Close! This is the answer to 6 x 6, but we want 6 x 5....
explanations.B: Julie runs 6 miles 5 times, so we do 6 x 5 = 30.
explanations.C: I think you added 6 and 5. Julie runs 6 miles 5 times, so we need to do 6 x 5.
explanations.D: I think you subtracted 5 from 6. Julie runs 6 miles 5 times, so we need to do 6 x 5.

explanations.A: 9 x 8 = 72, so if 8 people get 9 cupcakes each that gives us the total of 72 that we started with.
explanations.B: I think you did 72 - 9, but that would tell us how many cupcakes are left after one person takes 9 cupcakes. The question says everyone takes 9 cupcakes, so how many 9s are in 72?
explanations.C: I think you did 72 + 9, but that would mean there are more people than cakes! The question says everyone takes 9 cupcakes, so how many 9s are in 72?
explanations.D: Close! If 9 people got 7 cakes each, that would make 63 in total. We need 72 in total, so how many people might that be?

explanations.A: I think you did 60 + 5, but that would mean there are more people than cakes! The question says everyone takes 5 cupcakes, so how many 5s are in 60?
explanations.B: Close! If 10 people got 5 cakes each, that would make 50 in total. We need 60 in total, so how many people might that be?
explanations.C: I think you did 60 - 5, but that would tell us how many cupcakes are left after one person takes 5 cupcakes. The question says everyone takes 5 cupcakes, so how many 5s are in 60?
explanations.D: 5 x 12 = 60, so if 12 people get 5 cupcakes each that gives us the total of 60 that we started with.

explanations.A: Close! 7 packs of 6 cans would make 42 cans in total, but we need 48.
explanations.B: I think you added cans in one pack and cans in all the packs, but we want to know how many packs would make 48 cans in total. There are 6 cans in a pack, so how many 6s are in 48?
explanations.C: I think you subtracted 6 from 48, but we want to know how many packs would make 48 cans in total. There are 6 cans in a pack, so how many 6s are in 48?
explanations.D: 8 x 6 = 48, so 8 packs of 6 would make 48 cans in total.

explanations.D: I think you subtracted 12 from 72, but we want to know how many packs would make 72 cans in total. There are 12 cans in a pack, so how many 12s are in 72?

explanations.A: I think you added bananas in one bunch and total bananas, but we want to know how many bunches would make 81 bananas. There are 9 bananas in a bunch, so how many 9s in 81?
explanations.B: I think you subtracted bananas in one bunch from total bananas, but we want to know how many bunches would make 81 bananas. There are 9 bananas in a bunch, so how many 9s in 81?
explanations.C: 9 x 9 = 81, so 9 bunches of 9 would be enough for the race.
explanations.D: Close! 8 bunches of 9 would be 72 bananas total, but we need 81.

explanations.A: 7 x 7 = 49, so 7 bunches of 7 would be enough for the competition.

explanations.D: Close! 6 bunches of 7 would be 42 bananas total, but we need 49...
